content: The Act may be cited as the "Traumatic Brain Injury Act of 2006". Programs of Centers for Disease Control and Prevention are outlined in the Act. The Traumatic Brain Injury Act of 2006 includes amendments to the Public Health Service Act related to the prevention and surveillance of traumatic brain injuries. This includes changes to the use of allotments for rape prevention education and the national program for traumatic brain injury surveillance and registries. The Traumatic Brain Injury Act of 2006 amended the Public Health Service Act to allow grants to States for operating traumatic brain injury surveillance systems or registries to determine incidence and prevalence, ensure reporting uniformity, link individuals with services, and support academic research.
